parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. While the post mentions Ion Cristoiu and Mihai Tatulici, it does not explicitly endorse or oppose any parliamentary candidate participating in the current elections.  The reference to "Alegeri Prezidentiale" (Presidential Elections) is not relevant to the parliamentary elections covered by Article 98 t).</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content is designed to reach a wide audience, not just specific individuals.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The post promotes a news segment discussing a CCR decision regarding vote recounting in presidential elections. While this is a politically relevant topic, the primary objective of the post is to promote the news segment itself, not to influence votes in the parliamentary elections. There is no explicit call to action to vote for or against any specific candidate in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post appears to be journalistic in nature, promoting a news segment.  It aims to inform the public about a significant political event (the CCR decision), which aligns with journalistic practices.  There is no overt attempt to sway public opinion towards a particular candidate in the parliamentary elections.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express personal opinions; it promotes a news segment.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>925283196196905</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a news segment discussing a CCR decision on vote recounting in the presidential elections.  While politically charged, it does not directly advocate for or against any candidate in the parliamentary elections. The post's primary objective is to promote viewership of the news segment, not to influence the parliamentary elections.  The content is presented in a journalistic style, informing the public about a relevant political event.  The absence of any explicit endorsement or opposition to parliamentary candidates, combined with the journalistic presentation, suggests that the post does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t).
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Fanatik Online</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
